main event: A brilliant light was observed flying over Waterville, Maine, on September 6, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a large, bright, fluorescent, oval-shaped light about the size of a full moon., The light hovered for about three minutes before slowly moving and disappearing in the northeast., It was reported to have a slight halo of pale smoke around it., Citizens believed what they saw warranted a report., The weather at the time was clear with slightly hazy atmosphere and scattered thin clouds.
witness description: Civilian installing windows on his house
